annotation.spannedText: This is thanks to pockets of affluent, entitled parents full of the Dunning-Kruger effect who think that they can learn as much about vaccines and autism via Google University as pediatricians and researchers who have devoted their entire professional careers to studying them

annotation.spannedText: Based on information from current cases, it is likely that a person infectious with measles was at one of the theme parks on these dates

annotation.spannedText: From what I’ve been able to ascertain, most of the victims were not vaccinated

annotation.spannedText: This is in contrast to other outbreaks, where the majority of those getting the measles were actually vaccinated

annotation.spannedText: Antivaccinationists point to this, crying “Most of the measles cases were vaccinated!” This is a common antivaccine trope that sounds reasonable on the surface

annotation.spannedText: Unfortunately, the measles vaccine is not 100% effective

annotation.spannedText: No vaccine is

classMention.mentionClass: No vaccine is

annotation.spannedText: It is, however, highly effective, and, if one actually corrects for the percentage of the population that is vaccinated, one invariably finds in such outbreaks that the risk of acquiring measles is much higher in the unvaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: It is, however, highly effective, and, if one actually corrects for the percentage of the population that is vaccinated, one invariably finds in such outbreaks that the risk of acquiring measles is much higher in the unvaccinated

annotation.spannedText: In the Disneyland outbreak, antivaccine activists can’t even make that claim, as it appears that the majority of those who caught the measles were either unvaccinated or incompletely vaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: In the Disneyland outbreak, antivaccine activists can’t even make that claim, as it appears that the majority of those who caught the measles were either unvaccinated or incompletely vaccinated

annotation.spannedText: a theme park is an excellent incubator for an outbreak of a disease as highly infectious as the measles, particularly a theme park like Disneyland

annotation.spannedText: The problem, as we’ve documented many times here, is that Dr. Bob and his fellow antivaccine activists don’t give informed consent

annotation.spannedText: They provide “misinformed consent” that vastly inflates the risks of vaccines, attributes nonexistent risks to them (such as autism; more on that later), and minimizes the benefits of vaccines

annotation.spannedText: In our previous study, there was not any convincing evidence that MMR vaccination was associated with an increased risk of ASD in Japanese people. However, the effects due to the differences in vaccinations timing and the amount of exposure to thimerosal were not accounted for in this study

annotation.spannedText: The Japanese are a pretty genetically homogeneous people compared to most other areas where the question of whether vaccines cause autism has been studied, but, given the multiple resoundingly negative studies done before, it’s highly unlikely that doing it again in the Japanese would provide a different result, and it didn’t
